pullRequest.body:
In this PR, we define `lipschitzGroup`, `pinGroup` and `spinGroup`, and prove some basic lemmas.

Ported from leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/16040.

Co-authored-by: Jiale Miao <bm221@ic.ac.uk>
Co-authored-by: Eric Wieser <wieser.eric@gmail.com>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

This PR is a port of leanprover-community/mathlib#16040 .

- [x] Port all contents of leanprover-community/mathlib#16040
- [x] Prove `invertible_of_invertible_Î¹` missing from leanprover-community/mathlib#16040 (with @eric-wieser 's help)
  - [x] depends on: #9076 
- [x] Pass CI
- [x] Write a proper commit message for the PR, adding all co-authors and deps
- [x] Fix [naming issues](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/naming.html)
- [x] Fix [style issues](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/style.html)
- [x] Remove macro_rules
- [x] Minimize imports and deps
- [x] Add porting notes as PR comments
- [x] Rename `lipschitz` to `lipschitzGroup` and update doc, commit log etc.
- [x] Mark regressions from Lean 3 in this PR

This PR can be reviewed here or discussed on [Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144837-PR-reviews/topic/.2316040.20Spin.20Group).

nodes.body: !bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/5b7c79da-ab84-40e7-a600-5b6ba3760ef8) for commit 6fd601b43b12afde98455dfc110449e8498ccf37.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/9f1845ba-df2a-4ff5-a4ff-039fdb5fc0b1/to/5b7c79da-ab84-40e7-a600-5b6ba3760ef8) against commit eda0f8d332cf9d189519ad097a6fe7f1a6b01d19.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#9076~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Drive-by comment: is this awaiting review? Then it would help to label it as such, otherwise this may slip through the queue. :-)

Sorry, I made the same mistake again: I used `git pull origin master --rebase=false` to merge without rebase, but during pushing with VSCode, it did the rebase again. Now it's fixed by `git reset --hard 230250ce7b5b1bfc211ce37f381549685553b7ef`, redo the merge and fix, then a forced push.

This PR looks mostly fine, but there are still some places where it needs some work. Are you planning to continue working on this PR? Would you like some help from others, or do you want to hand over completely? (In the latter case, please label it with `please-adopt`.)

For discussions, see [zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/263328-triage/topic/PR.20!4.239111.3A.20feat.28LinearAlgebra.2FCliffordAlgebra.29.3A.20port.20Spi.2E.2E.2E). The only work left in this PR is to use the `Subgroup` approach instead of the `Submonoid` approach. @eric-wieser suggested this, and the reason was that

> quite a lot of the file seems to be fighting the fact that lipschitz is a subgroup of units but pinGroup is not, and so there's lots of conversion to do

but later he commented that 

> it's not so clear a win as I'd hoped, and want to write down why

so I didn't move forward with the suggestion.

My plan was to work on follow-up PRs built on this PR, but got distracted by other work. I think this PR is ready to merge as long as there is no objection to the `Submonoid` approach. I can also work out the `Subgroup` approach if it's clearly preferred.

My personal opinion is that this PR has been in an acceptable state for a(n unacceptably) long time, and that the `Subgroup` vs `Submonoid` design choice is not something that should prevent future work from happening. I agree that this can be figured out in a later PR. So...

maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
@eric-wieser can you have a final look?
bors merge

  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10462961275/job/28974162024)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10462961275/job/28974161764)
I'm afraid I had some pending comments from long ago that I forgot to submit.

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion rw [â† Algebra.commutes, â† Algebra.smul_def, â† map_smul, Algebra.smul_def, mul_invOf_self, changeForm_one] ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion rw [â† Algebra.smul_def, â† map_smul, Algebra.smul_def, mul_invOf_self, changeForm_one] ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion Invertible ((Î¹ Q m) * (Î¹ Q m)) := Invertible.mul â€¹_â€º â€¹_â€º ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion Invertible (algebraMap _ _ (Q m) : CliffordAlgebra Q) := ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion {x : (CliffordAlgebra Q)Ë£} (hx : x âˆˆ lipschitz Q) (b : M) : ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion Invertible (algebraMap _ _ (Q m) : CliffordAlgebra Q) := ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion {x : (CliffordAlgebra Q)Ë£} (hx : x âˆˆ lipschitz Q) (b : M) : ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion {x : (CliffordAlgebra Q)Ë£} (hx : x âˆˆ lipschitz Q) (b : M) : ```
Lean 4 requires the extra `HSMul.hSMul`
In Lean 3 it's fine to use `rw` but in Lean 4 I went through oceans to find that only `simp_all` works, not `simp` nor `simp_rw`.
I have no idea why I have to feed `one_smul` explicitly.

I got really confused by the naming, so I consitently use `a b c : M` and 

```lean
x y z : CliffordAlgebra Q -- sometimes (CliffordAlgebra Q)Ë£
```

I wonder how can I prove this without an explicit `use`, one should have no way of knowing the closed form of that vector.

Maybe some lemmas should be added back to be near `Î¹_mul_Î¹_mul_invOf_Î¹` and alike to avoid them here.
This goal is structurally similar to the previous one, I kept them as similar as possible, but I don't know how to golf them to avoid duplication.
Any reason why not `lipschitzGroup`?
Aligns are only for things which existed in mathlib3.

```suggestion
theorem conjAct_smul_range_Î¹_le_of_mem {x : (CliffordAlgebra Q)Ë£} (hx : x âˆˆ lipschitzGroup Q)
    [Invertible (2 : R)] :
    ConjAct.toConjAct x â€¢ LinearMap.range (Î¹ Q) â‰¤ LinearMap.range (Î¹ Q) := by
```
Maybe just a shorter `conjAct_le_of_mem` to capture the essence? Although your suggestion seems perfectly correct per Mathlib's naming convention.

@eric-wieser I've updated all references to `mem_conjAct_le` in the form of code suggestions, can you check if they all comply with the naming convention? Particularly `units_conjAct_smul_range_Î¹_le_of_mem`, and the inconsistent looking `units_mem_involute_act_le`.
I think you can drop the `units_` components of the names, but otherwise those suggestions look fine; can you apply them?
You should be able to use the `induction` tactic here and elsewhere
Checked that proofs are now all changed to use `induction`. Thanks!
This use of unicode is cute, but we should just use LaTeX for the benefit of readers of the web documentation.

Done, but there are 2 issues:

1. the readability is reduced for source code readers
2. doc-gen4 still has issues for LaTeX in markdown, in this case, a valid LaTeX `\{` has to be `\\{` for the `{` of the set to rendered correctly, similar LaTeX formulas are long broken in Mathlib 4 doc, [previous discussions](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/LaTeX.20problem.20in.20docstring) suggested that we should not fix the LaTeX formulas and should wait for the fix from doc-gen4 parser but it's been too long now, and I can't PR a broken LaTeX, so I have to fix it here, but it will be broken again once it's fixed on the parser end, either by doc-gen4 or verso.
Can you add this to `references.bib`?
Just added it, but `[fulton2004][]` is not very informative for someone is not aware of the existence of `references.bib`.

Plus, there is the issue of [doc-gen4's broken render of Bibliography](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/References.20in.20QuadraticForm.20and.20CliffordAlgebra.2EContraction).
This PR should not have any `#align`s; those are reserved for things that were merged to mathlib3!
Will remove all `#align`s.

I'd prefer that we PR the "broken" $\LaTeX$, so that when doc-gen is eventually fixed it ends up less broken rather than more broken:
```suggestion
$\{ x \in \mathop{\mathcal{C}\ell} | x \text{ is invertible and } x v x^{-1} âˆˆ V \}$ is given by:
```
I'm OK with either, but I'm not very optimistic about when it would be fixed.

```suggestion
at least as large as the other definition (See `lipschitzGroup.conjAct_smul_range_Î¹_le_of_mem` and
```

```suggestion
theorem units_conjAct_smul_range_Î¹_le_of_mem {x : (CliffordAlgebra Q)Ë£} (hx : â†‘x âˆˆ pinGroup Q)
```

```suggestion
  lipschitzGroup.conjAct_smul_range_Î¹_le_of_mem (units_mem_lipschitzGroup hx)
```

```suggestion
/-- This is another version of `units_conjAct_smul_range_Î¹_le_of_mem` which uses `involute`. -/
```

```suggestion
theorem units_conjAct_smul_range_Î¹_le_of_mem {x : (CliffordAlgebra Q)Ë£} (hx : â†‘x âˆˆ spinGroup Q)
```

```suggestion
  lipschitzGroup.conjAct_smul_range_Î¹_le_of_mem (units_mem_lipschitzGroup hx)
```

```suggestion
/- This is another version of `units_conjAct_smul_range_Î¹_le_of_mem` which uses `involute`.-/
```

This is automatically inferred
```suggestion
```
Can you turn this into a lemma about `StarMemClass` in the presence of `StarInvolutive`? The lemma should be called `StarMemClass.star_mem_iff`
That a good thing to have in general, but won't help here, because there is no `StarSubmonoid` or `StarSubgroup`.
Ah right

```suggestion
```

I wonder if this should be
```suggestion
def pinGroup (Q : QuadraticForm R M) : Subgroup (CliffordAlgebra Q)Ë£ :=
```
(which requires quite a few changes later)

The benefit is that this then matches `lipschitzGroup`

Can you split a `conjAct_Î¹_mem_range_Î¹ : ConjAct.toConjAct x â€¢ Î¹ Q m âˆˆ LinearMap.range (Î¹ Q)` statement out of this one, that matches `involute_act_Î¹_mem_range_Î¹`? You can use it to simplify the proof of this one.
I've extracted this lemma.

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion simp_rw [â† invOf_units x, â† ha, involute_Î¹, neg_mul, Î¹_mul_Î¹_mul_invOf_Î¹ Q a b, â† map_neg, ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion invOf_Î¹_mul_Î¹_mul_Î¹, â† map_neg, LinearMap.mem_range_self] ```
I've split this to #11809
